member.name: M:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.AmazonPartnerCentralSellingDefaultConfiguration.GetAllConfigurations
member.summary: Collection of all s supported by PartnerCentralSelling

summary.p: The STANDARD mode provides the latest recommended default values that should be safe to run in most scenarios
Note that the default values vended from this mode might change as best practices may evolve. As a result, it is encouraged to perform tests when upgrading the SDK
The IN_REGION mode builds on the standard mode and includes optimization tailored for applications which call AWS services from within the same AWS region
Note that the default values vended from this mode might change as best practices may evolve. As a result, it is encouraged to perform tests when upgrading the SDK
The CROSS_REGION mode builds on the standard mode and includes optimization tailored for applications which call AWS services in a different region
Note that the default values vended from this mode might change as best practices may evolve. As a result, it is encouraged to perform tests when upgrading the SDK
The MOBILE mode builds on the standard mode and includes optimization tailored for mobile applications
Note that the default values vended from this mode might change as best practices may evolve. As a result, it is encouraged to perform tests when upgrading the SDK
The AUTO mode is an experimental mode that builds on the standard mode. The SDK will attempt to discover the execution environment to determine the appropriate settings automatically.

Note that the auto detection is heuristics-based and does not guarantee 100% accuracy. STANDARD mode will be used if the execution environment cannot be determined. The auto detection might query EC2 Instance Metadata service, which might introduce latency. Therefore we recommend choosing an explicit defaults_mode instead if startup latency is critical to your application
The LEGACY mode provides default settings that vary per SDK and were used prior to establishment of defaults_mode

member.name: T:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Endpoints.PartnerCentralSellingEndpointParameters
member.summary: Contains parameters used for resolving PartnerCentralSelling endpoints Parameters can be sourced from client config and service operations Used by internal PartnerCentralSellingEndpointProvider and PartnerCentralSellingEndpointResolver Can be used by custom EndpointProvider, see ClientConfig.EndpointProvider

member.name: T:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.AmazonPartnerCentralSellingException
member.summary: Common exception for the PartnerCentralSelling service.

member.name: T:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Internal.AmazonPartnerCentralSellingEndpointProvider
member.summary: Amazon PartnerCentralSelling endpoint provider. Resolves endpoint for given set of PartnerCentralSellingEndpointParameters. Can throw AmazonClientException if endpoint resolution is unsuccessful.

member.name: T:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Internal.AmazonPartnerCentralSellingEndpointResolver
member.summary: Amazon PartnerCentralSelling endpoint resolver. Custom PipelineHandler responsible for resolving endpoint and setting authentication parameters for PartnerCentralSelling service requests. Collects values for PartnerCentralSellingEndpointParameters and then tries to resolve endpoint by calling ResolveEndpoint method on GlobalEndpoints.Provider if present, otherwise uses PartnerCentralSellingEndpointProvider. Responsible for setting authentication and http headers provided by resolved endpoint.

member.name: T:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.AcceptEngagementInvitationRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the AcceptEngagementInvitation operation. Use the AcceptEngagementInvitation action to accept an engagement invitation shared by AWS. Accepting the invitation indicates your willingness to participate in the engagement, granting you access to all engagement-related data.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.AcceptEngagementInvitationRequest.Catalog
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Catalog.
The CatalogType parameter specifies the catalog associated with the engagement invitation. Accepted values are AWS and Sandbox, which determine the environment in which the engagement invitation is managed.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.AcceptEngagementInvitationRequest.Identifier
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Identifier.
The Identifier parameter in the AcceptEngagementInvitationRequest specifies the unique identifier of the EngagementInvitation to be accepted. Providing the correct identifier ensures that the intended invitation is accepted.

member.name: T:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.AcceptEngagementInvitationResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the AcceptEngagementInvitation operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.AccessDeniedException

member.summary:

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.Account.AwsAccountId
member.summary:

Specifies the Customer Amazon Web Services account ID associated with the Opportunity.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.Account.CompanyName
member.summary:

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.Account.Duns

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.Account.Industry
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Industry.
Specifies the industry the end Customer belongs to that's associated with the Opportunity. It refers to the category or sector where the customer's business operates. This is a required field.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.Account.OtherIndustry
member.summary:

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.Account.WebsiteUrl
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property WebsiteUrl.
Specifies the end customer's company website URL associated with the Opportunity. This value is crucial to map the customer within the Amazon Web Services CRM system. This field is required in all cases except when the opportunity is related to national security.

member.name: T:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.AccountReceiver

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.AccountReceiver.Alias
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Alias.
Represents the alias of the partner account receiving the Engagement Invitation, making it easier to identify and track the recipient in reports or logs.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.AccountReceiver.AwsAccountId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AwsAccountId.
Indicates the AWS account ID of the partner who received the Engagement Invitation. This is a unique identifier for managing engagements with specific AWS accounts.

member.name: T:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.AssigneeContact
member.summary: Represents the contact details of the individual assigned to manage the opportunity within the partner organization. This helps to ensure that there is a point of contact for the opportunity's progress.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.AssigneeContact.BusinessTitle
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BusinessTitle.
Specifies the business title of the assignee managing the opportunity. This helps clarify the individual's role and responsibilities within the organization. Use the value PartnerAccountManager to update details of the opportunity owner.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.AssigneeContact.Email
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Email.
Provides the email address of the assignee. This email is used for communications and notifications related to the opportunity.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.AssigneeContact.FirstName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FirstName.
Specifies the first name of the assignee managing the opportunity. The system automatically retrieves this value from the user profile by referencing the associated email address.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.AssigneeContact.LastName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LastName.
Specifies the last name of the assignee managing the opportunity. The system automatically retrieves this value from the user profile by referencing the associated email address.

member.name: T:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.AssignOpportunityRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the AssignOpportunity operation. Enables you to reassign an existing Opportunity to another user within your Partner Central account. The specified user receives the opportunity, and it appears on their Partner Central dashboard, allowing them to take necessary actions or proceed with the opportunity.
This is useful for distributing opportunities to the appropriate team members or departments within your organization, ensuring that each opportunity is handled by the right person. By default, the opportunity owner is the one who creates it. Currently, there's no API to enumerate the list of available users.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.AssignOpportunityRequest.Assignee
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Assignee.
Specifies the user or team member responsible for managing the assigned opportunity. This field identifies the Assignee based on the partner's internal team structure. Ensure that the email address is associated with a registered user in your Partner Central account.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.AssignOpportunityRequest.Catalog
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Catalog.
Specifies the catalog associated with the request. This field takes a string value from a predefined list: AWS or Sandbox. The catalog determines which environment the opportunity is assigned in. Use AWS to assign real opportunities in the Amazon Web Services catalog, and Sandbox for testing in secure, isolated environments.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.AssignOpportunityRequest.Identifier
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Identifier.
Requires the Opportunity's unique identifier when you want to assign it to another user. Provide the correct identifier so the intended opportunity is reassigned.

member.name: T:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.AssignOpportunityResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the AssignOpportunity operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.AssociateOpportunityRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the AssociateOpportunity operation. Enables you to create a formal association between an Opportunity and various related entities, enriching the context and details of the opportunity for better collaboration and decision making. You can associate an opportunity with the following entity types:
Partner Solution: A software product or consulting practice created and delivered by Partners. Partner Solutions help customers address business challenges using Amazon Web Services services.
Amazon Web Services Products: Amazon Web Services offers many products and services that provide scalable, reliable, and cost-effective infrastructure solutions. For the latest list of Amazon Web Services products, see Amazon Web Services products.
Amazon Web Services Marketplace private offer: Allows Amazon Web Services Marketplace sellers to extend custom pricing and terms to individual Amazon Web Services customers. Sellers can negotiate custom prices, payment schedules, and end user license terms through private offers, enabling Amazon Web Services customers to acquire software solutions tailored to their specific needs. For more information, see Private offers in Amazon Web Services Marketplace.
To obtain identifiers for these entities, use the following methods:
Solution: Use the ListSolutions operation.
AWS Products: For the latest list of Amazon Web Services products, see Amazon Web Services products.
Amazon Web Services Marketplace private offer: Use the Using the Amazon Web Services Marketplace Catalog API to list entities. Specifically, use the ListEntities operation to retrieve a list of private offers. The request returns the details of available private offers. For more information, see ListEntities.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.AssociateOpportunityRequest.Catalog
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Catalog.
Specifies the catalog associated with the request. This field takes a string value from a predefined list: AWS or Sandbox. The catalog determines which environment the opportunity association is made in. Use AWS to associate opportunities in the Amazon Web Services catalog, and Sandbox for testing in secure, isolated environments.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.AssociateOpportunityRequest.OpportunityIdentifier
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property OpportunityIdentifier.
Requires the Opportunity's unique identifier when you want to associate it with a related entity. Provide the correct identifier so the intended opportunity is updated with the association.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.AssociateOpportunityRequest.RelatedEntityIdentifier
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RelatedEntityIdentifier.
Requires the related entity's unique identifier when you want to associate it with the Opportunity. For Amazon Web Services Marketplace entities, provide the Amazon Resource Name (ARN). Use the Amazon Web Services Marketplace API to obtain the ARN.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.AssociateOpportunityRequest.RelatedEntityType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RelatedEntityType.
Specifies the entity type that you're associating with the Opportunity. This helps to categorize and properly process the association.

member.name: T:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.AssociateOpportunityResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the AssociateOpportunity operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.AwsOpportunityCustomer
member.summary: Represents the customer associated with the AWS opportunity. This field captures key details about the customer that are necessary for managing the opportunity.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.AwsOpportunityCustomer.Contacts
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Contacts.
Provides a list of customer contacts involved in the opportunity. These contacts may include decision makers, influencers, and other stakeholders within the customer's organization.

member.name: T:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.AwsOpportunityInsights
member.summary: Contains insights provided by AWS for the opportunity, offering recommendations and analysis that can help the partner optimize their engagement and strategy.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.AwsOpportunityInsights.EngagementScore
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EngagementScore.
Represents a score assigned by AWS to indicate the level of engagement and potential success for the opportunity. This score helps partners prioritize their efforts.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.AwsOpportunityInsights.NextBestActions
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextBestActions.
Provides recommendations from AWS on the next best actions to take in order to move the opportunity forward and increase the likelihood of success.

member.name: T:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.AwsOpportunityLifeCycle
member.summary: Tracks the lifecycle of the AWS opportunity, including stages such as qualification, validation, and closure. This field helps partners understand the current status and progression of the opportunity.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.AwsOpportunityLifeCycle.ClosedLostReason
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ClosedLostReason.
Indicates the reason why an opportunity was marked as Closed Lost. This helps in understanding the context behind the lost opportunity and aids in refining future strategies.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.AwsOpportunityLifeCycle.NextSteps
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextSteps.
Specifies the immediate next steps required to progress the opportunity. These steps are based on AWS guidance and the current stage of the opportunity.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.AwsOpportunityLifeCycle.NextStepsHistory
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextStepsHistory.
Provides a historical log of previous next steps that were taken to move the opportunity forward. This helps in tracking the decision-making process and identifying any delays or obstacles encountered.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.AwsOpportunityLifeCycle.Stage
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Stage.
Represents the current stage of the opportunity in its lifecycle, such as Qualification, Validation, or Closed Won. This helps in understanding the opportunity's progress.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.AwsOpportunityLifeCycle.TargetCloseDate
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TargetCloseDate.
Indicates the expected date by which the opportunity is projected to close. This field helps in planning resources and timelines for both the partner and AWS.

member.name: T:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.AwsOpportunityProject
member.summary: Captures details about the project associated with the opportunity, including objectives, scope, and customer requirements.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.AwsOpportunityProject.ExpectedCustomerSpend
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ExpectedCustomerSpend.
Indicates the expected spending by the customer over the course of the project. This value helps partners and AWS estimate the financial impact of the opportunity. Use the AWS Pricing Calculator to create an estimate of the customer’s total spend. If only annual recurring revenue (ARR) is available, distribute it across 12 months to provide an average monthly value.

member.name: T:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.AwsOpportunityRelatedEntities
member.summary: Represents other entities related to the AWS opportunity, such as AWS products, partner solutions, and marketplace offers. These associations help build a complete picture of the solution being sold.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.AwsOpportunityRelatedEntities.AwsProducts
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AwsProducts.
Specifies the AWS products associated with the opportunity. This field helps track the specific products that are part of the proposed solution.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.AwsOpportunityRelatedEntities.Solutions
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Solutions.
Specifies the partner solutions related to the opportunity. These solutions represent the partner's offerings that are being positioned as part of the overall AWS opportunity.

member.name: T:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.AwsSubmission
member.summary: Indicates the level of AWS involvement in the opportunity. This field helps track AWS participation throughout the engagement, such as providing technical support, deal assistance, and sales support.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.AwsSubmission.InvolvementType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InvolvementType.
Specifies the type of AWS involvement in the opportunity, such as coselling, deal support, or technical consultation. This helps categorize the nature of AWS participation.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.AwsSubmission.Visibility
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Visibility.
Determines who can view AWS involvement in the opportunity. Typically, this field is set to Full for most cases, but it may be restricted based on special program requirements or confidentiality needs.

member.name: T:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.AwsTeamMember
member.summary: Represents an Amazon Web Services team member for the engagement. This structure includes details such as name, email, and business title.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.AwsTeamMember.BusinessTitle
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BusinessTitle.
Specifies the Amazon Web Services team member's business title and indicates their organizational role.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.AwsTeamMember.Email
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Email.
Provides the Amazon Web Services team member's email address.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.AwsTeamMember.FirstName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FirstName.
Provides the Amazon Web Services team member's first name.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.AwsTeamMember.LastName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LastName.
Provides the Amazon Web Services team member's last name.

member.name: T:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.ConflictException
member.summary:
This error occurs when the request can’t be processed due to a conflict with the target resource's current state, which could result from updating or deleting the resource.
Suggested action: Fetch the latest state of the resource, verify the state, and retry the request.

member.name: M:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.ConflictException.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructs a new ConflictException with the specified error message.
member.param: Describes the error encountered.

The partner contact's title (job title or role) associated with the Opportunity. BusinessTitle supports either PartnerAccountManager or OpportunityOwner.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.Contact.Email
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Email.
The contact's email address associated with the Opportunity.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.Contact.FirstName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FirstName.
The contact's first name associated with the Opportunity.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.Contact.LastName

The contact's last name associated with the Opportunity.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.Contact.Phone
