member.name: T:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.CreateEngagementInvitationRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the CreateEngagementInvitation operation. This action creates an invitation from a sender to a single receiver to join an engagement.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.CreateEngagementInvitationRequest.Catalog
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Catalog.
Specifies the catalog related to the engagement. Accepted values are AWS and Sandbox, which determine the environment in which the engagement is managed.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.CreateEngagementInvitationRequest.ClientToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ClientToken.
Specifies a unique, client-generated UUID to ensure that the request is handled exactly once. This token helps prevent duplicate invitation creations.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.CreateEngagementInvitationRequest.EngagementIdentifier
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EngagementIdentifier.
The unique identifier of the Engagement associated with the invitation. This parameter ensures the invitation is created within the correct Engagement context.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.CreateEngagementInvitationRequest.Invitation
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Invitation.
The Invitation object all information necessary to initiate an engagement invitation to a partner. It contains a personalized message from the sender, the invitation's receiver, and a payload. The Payload can be the OpportunityInvitation, which includes detailed structures for sender contacts, partner responsibilities, customer information, and project details.

member.name: T:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.CreateEngagementInvitationResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the CreateEngagementInvitation operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.CreateEngagementInvitationResponse.Arn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Arn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies the engagement invitation.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.CreateEngagementInvitationResponse.Id
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Id.
Unique identifier assigned to the newly created engagement invitation.

member.name: T:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.CreateEngagementRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the CreateEngagement operation. The CreateEngagement action allows you to create an Engagement, which serves as a collaborative space between different parties such as AWS Partners and AWS Sellers. This action automatically adds the caller's AWS account as an active member of the newly created Engagement.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.CreateEngagementRequest.Catalog
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Catalog.
The CreateEngagementRequest$Catalog parameter specifies the catalog related to the engagement. Accepted values are AWS and Sandbox, which determine the environment in which the engagement is managed.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.CreateEngagementRequest.ClientToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ClientToken.
The CreateEngagementRequest$ClientToken parameter specifies a unique, case-sensitive identifier to ensure that the request is handled exactly once. The value must not exceed sixty-four alphanumeric characters.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.CreateEngagementRequest.Contexts
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Contexts.
The Contexts field is a required array of objects, with a maximum of 5 contexts allowed, specifying detailed information about customer projects associated with the Engagement. Each context object contains a Type field indicating the context type, which must be CustomerProject in this version, and a Payload field containing the CustomerProject details. The CustomerProject object is composed of two main components: Customer and Project. The Customer object includes information such as CompanyName, WebsiteUrl, Industry, and CountryCode, providing essential details about the customer. The Project object contains Title, BusinessProblem, and TargetCompletionDate, offering insights into the specific project associated with the customer. This structure allows comprehensive context to be included within the Engagement, facilitating effective collaboration between parties by providing relevant customer and project information.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.CreateEngagementRequest.Description
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Description.
Provides a description of the Engagement.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.CreateEngagementRequest.Title
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Title.
Specifies the title of the Engagement.

member.name: T:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.CreateEngagementResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the CreateEngagement operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.CreateEngagementResponse.Arn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Arn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that identifies the engagement.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.CreateEngagementResponse.Id
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Id.
Unique identifier assigned to the newly created engagement.

member.name: T:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.CreateOpportunityRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the CreateOpportunity operation. Creates an Opportunity record in Partner Central. Use this operation to create a potential business opportunity for submission to Amazon Web Services. Creating an opportunity sets Lifecycle.ReviewStatus to Pending Submission.
To submit an opportunity, follow these steps:
To create the opportunity, use CreateOpportunity.
To associate a solution with the opportunity, use AssociateOpportunity.
To submit the opportunity, use StartEngagementFromOpportunityTask.
After submission, you can't edit the opportunity until the review is complete. But opportunities in the Pending Submission state must have complete details. You can update the opportunity while it's in the Pending Submission state.
There's a set of mandatory fields to create opportunities, but consider providing optional fields to enrich the opportunity record.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.CreateOpportunityRequest.Catalog
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Catalog.
Specifies the catalog associated with the request. This field takes a string value from a predefined list: AWS or Sandbox. The catalog determines which environment the opportunity is created in. Use AWS to create opportunities in the Amazon Web Services catalog, and Sandbox for testing in secure, isolated environments.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.CreateOpportunityRequest.ClientToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ClientToken.
Required to be unique, and should be unchanging, it can be randomly generated or a meaningful string.
Default: None
Best practice: To help ensure uniqueness and avoid conflicts, use a Universally Unique Identifier (UUID) as the ClientToken. You can use standard libraries from most programming languages to generate this. If you use the same client token, the API returns the following error: "Conflicting client token submitted for a new request body."

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.CreateOpportunityRequest.Customer
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Customer.
Specifies customer details associated with the Opportunity.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.CreateOpportunityRequest.LifeCycle
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LifeCycle.
An object that contains lifecycle details for the Opportunity.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.CreateOpportunityRequest.Marketing
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Marketing.
This object contains marketing details and is optional for an opportunity.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.CreateOpportunityRequest.NationalSecurity
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NationalSecurity.
Indicates whether the Opportunity pertains to a national security project. This field must be set to true only when the customer's industry is Government. Additional privacy and security measures apply during the review and management process for opportunities marked as NationalSecurity.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.CreateOpportunityRequest.OpportunityTeam
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property OpportunityTeam.
Represents the internal team handling the opportunity. Specify collaborating members of this opportunity who are within the partner's organization.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.CreateOpportunityRequest.OpportunityType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property OpportunityType.
Specifies the opportunity type as a renewal, new, or expansion.
Opportunity types:
New opportunity: Represents a new business opportunity with a potential customer that's not previously engaged with your solutions or services.
Renewal opportunity: Represents an opportunity to renew an existing contract or subscription with a current customer, ensuring continuity of service.
Expansion opportunity: Represents an opportunity to expand the scope of an existing contract or subscription, either by adding new services or increasing the volume of existing services for a current customer.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.CreateOpportunityRequest.Origin
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Origin.
Specifies the origin of the opportunity, indicating if it was sourced from Amazon Web Services or the partner. For all opportunities created with Catalog: AWS, this field must only be Partner Referral. However, when using Catalog: Sandbox, you can set this field to AWS Referral to simulate Amazon Web Services referral creation. This allows Amazon Web Services-originated flows testing in the sandbox catalog.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.CreateOpportunityRequest.PartnerOpportunityIdentifier
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PartnerOpportunityIdentifier.
Specifies the opportunity's unique identifier in the partner's CRM system. This value is essential to track and reconcile because it's included in the outbound payload to the partner.
This field allows partners to link an opportunity to their CRM, which helps to ensure seamless integration and accurate synchronization between the Partner Central API and the partner's internal systems.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.CreateOpportunityRequest.PrimaryNeedsFromAws
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PrimaryNeedsFromAws.
Identifies the type of support the partner needs from Amazon Web Services.
Valid values:
Cosell—Architectural Validation: Confirmation from Amazon Web Services that the partner's proposed solution architecture is aligned with Amazon Web Services best practices and poses minimal architectural risks.
Cosell—Business Presentation: Request Amazon Web Services seller's participation in a joint customer presentation.
Cosell—Competitive Information: Access to Amazon Web Services competitive resources and support for the partner's proposed solution.
Cosell—Pricing Assistance: Connect with an Amazon Web Services seller for support situations where a partner may be receiving an upfront discount on a service (for example: EDP deals).
Cosell—Technical Consultation: Connect with an Amazon Web Services Solutions Architect to address the partner's questions about the proposed solution.
Cosell—Total Cost of Ownership Evaluation: Assistance with quoting different cost savings of proposed solutions on Amazon Web Services versus on-premises or a traditional hosting environment.
Cosell—Deal Support: Request Amazon Web Services seller's support to progress the opportunity (for example: joint customer call, strategic positioning).
Cosell—Support for Public Tender/RFx: Opportunity related to the public sector where the partner needs Amazon Web Services RFx support.
Do Not Need Support from AWS Sales Rep: Indicates that a partner doesn't need support from an Amazon Web Services sales representative, and the partner solely manages the opportunity. It's possible to request coselling support on these opportunities at any stage during their lifecycles. This is also known as a for-visibility-only (FVO) opportunity.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.CreateOpportunityRequest.Project
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Project.
An object that contains project details for the Opportunity.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.CreateOpportunityRequest.SoftwareRevenue
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SoftwareRevenue.
Specifies details of a customer's procurement terms. This is required only for partners in eligible programs.

member.name: T:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.CreateOpportunityResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the CreateOpportunity operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.CreateOpportunityResponse.Id
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Id.
Read-only, system-generated Opportunity unique identifier. Amazon Web Services creates this identifier, and it's used for all subsequent opportunity actions, such as updates, associations, and submissions. It helps to ensure that each opportunity is accurately tracked and managed.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.CreateOpportunityResponse.LastModifiedDate
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LastModifiedDate.
DateTime when the opportunity was last modified. When the Opportunity is created, its value is CreatedDate.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.CreateOpportunityResponse.PartnerOpportunityIdentifier
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PartnerOpportunityIdentifier.
Specifies the opportunity's unique identifier in the partner's CRM system. This value is essential to track and reconcile because it's included in the outbound payload sent back to the partner.

member.name: T:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.CreateResourceSnapshotJobRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the CreateResourceSnapshotJob operation. Use this action to create a job to generate a snapshot of the specified resource within an engagement. It initiates an asynchronous process to create a resource snapshot. The job creates a new snapshot only if the resource state has changed, adhering to the same access control and immutability rules as direct snapshot creation.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.CreateResourceSnapshotJobRequest.Catalog
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Catalog.
Specifies the catalog in which to create the snapshot job. Valid values are AWS and Sandbox.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.CreateResourceSnapshotJobRequest.ClientToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ClientToken.
Specifies a unique, client-generated UUID to ensure that the request is handled exactly once. This token helps prevent duplicate snapshot job creations.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.CreateResourceSnapshotJobRequest.EngagementIdentifier
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EngagementIdentifier.
Specifies the identifier of the engagement associated with the resource to be snapshotted.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.CreateResourceSnapshotJobRequest.ResourceIdentifier
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ResourceIdentifier.
Specifies the identifier of the specific resource to be snapshotted. The format depends on the ResourceType.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.CreateResourceSnapshotJobRequest.ResourceSnapshotTemplateIdentifier
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ResourceSnapshotTemplateIdentifier.
Specifies the name of the template that defines the schema for the snapshot.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.CreateResourceSnapshotJobRequest.ResourceType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ResourceType.
The type of resource for which the snapshot job is being created. Must be one of the supported resource types Opportunity.

member.name: T:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.CreateResourceSnapshotJobResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the CreateResourceSnapshotJob operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.CreateResourceSnapshotJobResponse.Arn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Arn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the created snapshot job.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.CreateResourceSnapshotJobResponse.Id
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Id.
The unique identifier for the created snapshot job.

member.name: T:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.CreateResourceSnapshotRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the CreateResourceSnapshot operation. This action allows you to create an immutable snapshot of a specific resource, such as an opportunity, within the context of an engagement. The snapshot captures a subset of the resource's data based on the schema defined by the provided template.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.CreateResourceSnapshotRequest.Catalog
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Catalog.
Specifies the catalog where the snapshot is created. Valid values are AWS and Sandbox.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.CreateResourceSnapshotRequest.ClientToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ClientToken.
Specifies a unique, client-generated UUID to ensure that the request is handled exactly once. This token helps prevent duplicate snapshot creations.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.CreateResourceSnapshotRequest.EngagementIdentifier
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EngagementIdentifier.
The unique identifier of the engagement associated with this snapshot. This field links the snapshot to a specific engagement context.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.CreateResourceSnapshotRequest.ResourceIdentifier
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ResourceIdentifier.
The unique identifier of the specific resource to be snapshotted. The format and constraints of this identifier depend on the ResourceType specified. For example: For Opportunity type, it will be an opportunity ID.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.CreateResourceSnapshotRequest.ResourceSnapshotTemplateIdentifier
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ResourceSnapshotTemplateIdentifier.
The name of the template that defines the schema for the snapshot. This template determines which subset of the resource data will be included in the snapshot. Must correspond to an existing and valid template for the specified ResourceType.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.CreateResourceSnapshotRequest.ResourceType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ResourceType.
Specifies the type of resource for which the snapshot is being created. This field determines the structure and content of the snapshot. Must be one of the supported resource types, such as: Opportunity.

member.name: T:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.CreateResourceSnapshotResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the CreateResourceSnapshot operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.CreateResourceSnapshotResponse.Arn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Arn.
Specifies the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies the snapshot created.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.CreateResourceSnapshotResponse.Revision
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Revision.
Specifies the revision number of the created snapshot. This field provides important information about the snapshot's place in the sequence of snapshots for the given resource.

member.name: T:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.Customer
member.summary: An object that contains the customer's Account and Contact.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.Customer.Account
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Account.
An object that contains the customer's account details.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.Customer.Contacts
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Contacts.
Represents the contact details for individuals associated with the customer of the Opportunity. This field captures relevant contacts, including decision-makers, influencers, and technical stakeholders within the customer organization. These contacts are key to progressing the opportunity.

member.name: T:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.CustomerProjectsContext
member.summary:
The CustomerProjects structure in Engagements offers a flexible framework for managing customer-project relationships. It supports multiple customers per Engagement and multiple projects per customer, while also allowing for customers without projects and projects without specific customers.
All Engagement members have full visibility of customers and their associated projects, enabling the capture of relevant context even when project details are not fully defined. This structure also facilitates targeted invitations, allowing partners to focus on specific customers and their business problems when sending Engagement invitations.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.CustomerProjectsContext.Customer
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Customer.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.CustomerProjectsContext.Project
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Project.
Information about the customer project associated with the Engagement.

member.name: T:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.CustomerSummary
member.summary: An object that contains a Customer object's subset of fields.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.CustomerSummary.Account
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Account.
An object that contains a customer's account details.

member.name: T:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.DeleteResourceSnapshotJobRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the DeleteResourceSnapshotJob operation. Use this action to deletes a previously created resource snapshot job. The job must be in a stopped state before it can be deleted.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.DeleteResourceSnapshotJobRequest.Catalog
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Catalog.
Specifies the catalog from which to delete the snapshot job. Valid values are AWS and Sandbox.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.DeleteResourceSnapshotJobRequest.ResourceSnapshotJobIdentifier
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ResourceSnapshotJobIdentifier.
The unique identifier of the resource snapshot job to be deleted.

member.name: T:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.DeleteResourceSnapshotJobResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the DeleteResourceSnapshotJob operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.DisassociateOpportunityRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the DisassociateOpportunity operation. Allows you to remove an existing association between an Opportunity and related entities, such as a Partner Solution, Amazon Web Services product, or an Amazon Web Services Marketplace offer. This operation is the counterpart to AssociateOpportunity, and it provides flexibility to manage associations as business needs change.
Use this operation to update the associations of an Opportunity due to changes in the related entities, or if an association was made in error. Ensuring accurate associations helps maintain clarity and accuracy to track and manage business opportunities. When you replace an entity, first attach the new entity and then disassociate the one to be removed, especially if it's the last remaining entity that's required.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.DisassociateOpportunityRequest.Catalog
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Catalog.
Specifies the catalog associated with the request. This field takes a string value from a predefined list: AWS or Sandbox. The catalog determines which environment the opportunity disassociation is made in. Use AWS to disassociate opportunities in the Amazon Web Services catalog, and Sandbox for testing in secure, isolated environments.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.DisassociateOpportunityRequest.OpportunityIdentifier
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property OpportunityIdentifier.
The opportunity's unique identifier for when you want to disassociate it from related entities. This identifier helps to ensure that the correct opportunity is updated.
Validation: Ensure that the provided identifier corresponds to an existing opportunity in the Amazon Web Services system because incorrect identifiers result in an error and no changes are made.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.DisassociateOpportunityRequest.RelatedEntityIdentifier
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RelatedEntityIdentifier.
The related entity's identifier that you want to disassociate from the opportunity. Depending on the type of entity, this could be a simple identifier or an Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for entities managed through Amazon Web Services Marketplace.
For Amazon Web Services Marketplace entities, use the Amazon Web Services Marketplace API to obtain the necessary ARNs. For guidance on retrieving these ARNs, see Amazon Web Services MarketplaceUsing the Amazon Web Services Marketplace Catalog API.
Validation: Ensure the identifier or ARN is valid and corresponds to an existing entity. An incorrect or invalid identifier results in an error.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.DisassociateOpportunityRequest.RelatedEntityType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RelatedEntityType.
The type of the entity that you're disassociating from the opportunity. When you specify the entity type, it helps the system correctly process the disassociation request to ensure that the right connections are removed.
Examples of entity types include Partner Solution, Amazon Web Services product, and Amazon Web Services Marketplaceoffer. Ensure that the value matches one of the expected entity types.
Validation: Provide a valid entity type to help ensure successful disassociation. An invalid or incorrect entity type results in an error.

member.name: T:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.DisassociateOpportunityResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the DisassociateOpportunity operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.EngagementContextDetails
member.summary: Provides detailed context information for an Engagement. This structure allows for specifying the type of context and its associated payload.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.EngagementContextDetails.Payload
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Payload.
Contains the specific details of the Engagement context. The structure of this payload varies depending on the Type field.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.EngagementContextDetails.Type
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Type.
Specifies the type of Engagement context. Valid values are "CustomerProject" or "Document", indicating whether the context relates to a customer project or a document respectively.

member.name: T:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.EngagementContextPayload
member.summary: Represents the payload of an Engagement context. The structure of this payload varies based on the context type specified in the EngagementContextDetails.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.EngagementContextPayload.CustomerProject
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CustomerProject.
Contains detailed information about a customer project when the context type is "CustomerProject". This field is present only when the Type in EngagementContextDetails is set to "CustomerProject".

member.name: T:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.EngagementCustomer
member.summary: Contains details about the customer associated with the Engagement Invitation, including company information and industry.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.EngagementCustomer.CompanyName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CompanyName.
Represents the name of the customer’s company associated with the Engagement Invitation. This field is used to identify the customer.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.EngagementCustomer.CountryCode
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CountryCode.
Indicates the country in which the customer’s company operates. This field is useful for understanding regional requirements or compliance needs.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.EngagementCustomer.Industry
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Industry.
Specifies the industry to which the customer’s company belongs. This field helps categorize the opportunity based on the customer’s business sector.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.EngagementCustomer.WebsiteUrl
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property WebsiteUrl.
Provides the website URL of the customer’s company. This field helps partners verify the legitimacy and size of the customer organization.

member.name: T:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.EngagementCustomerProjectDetails
member.summary: Provides comprehensive details about a customer project associated with an Engagement. This may include information such as project goals, timelines, and specific customer requirements.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.EngagementCustomerProjectDetails.BusinessProblem
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BusinessProblem.
A description of the business problem the project aims to solve.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.EngagementCustomerProjectDetails.TargetCompletionDate
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TargetCompletionDate.
The target completion date for the customer's project.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.EngagementCustomerProjectDetails.Title
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Title.
The title of the project.

member.name: T:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.EngagementInvitationSummary
member.summary: Provides a summarized view of the Engagement Invitation, including details like the identifier, status, and sender. This summary helps partners track and manage AWS originated opportunities.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.EngagementInvitationSummary.Arn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Arn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Engagement Invitation. The ARN is a unique identifier that allows partners to reference the invitation in their system and manage its lifecycle.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.EngagementInvitationSummary.Catalog
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Catalog.
Specifies the catalog in which the Engagement Invitation resides. This can be either the AWS or Sandbox catalog, indicating whether the opportunity is live or being tested.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.EngagementInvitationSummary.EngagementId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EngagementId.
The identifier of the Engagement associated with this invitation. This links the invitation to its parent Engagement.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.EngagementInvitationSummary.EngagementTitle
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EngagementTitle.
Provides a short title or description of the Engagement Invitation. This title helps partners quickly identify and differentiate between multiple engagement opportunities.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.EngagementInvitationSummary.ExpirationDate
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ExpirationDate.
Indicates the date and time when the Engagement Invitation will expire. After this date, the invitation can no longer be accepted, and the opportunity will be unavailable to the partner.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.EngagementInvitationSummary.Id
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Id.
Represents the unique identifier of the Engagement Invitation. This identifier is used to track the invitation and to manage responses like acceptance or rejection.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.EngagementInvitationSummary.InvitationDate
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InvitationDate.
Indicates the date when the Engagement Invitation was sent to the partner. This provides context for when the opportunity was shared and helps in tracking the timeline for engagement.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.EngagementInvitationSummary.ParticipantType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ParticipantType.
Identifies the role of the caller in the engagement invitation.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.EngagementInvitationSummary.PayloadType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PayloadType.
Describes the type of payload associated with the Engagement Invitation, such as Opportunity or MarketplaceOffer. This helps partners understand the nature of the engagement request from AWS.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.EngagementInvitationSummary.Receiver
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Receiver.
Specifies the partner company or individual that received the Engagement Invitation. This field is important for tracking who the invitation was sent to within the partner organization.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.EngagementInvitationSummary.SenderAwsAccountId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SenderAwsAccountId.
Specifies the AWS account ID of the sender who initiated the Engagement Invitation. This allows the partner to identify the AWS entity or representative responsible for sharing the opportunity.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.EngagementInvitationSummary.SenderCompanyName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SenderCompanyName.
Indicates the name of the company or AWS division that sent the Engagement Invitation. This information is useful for partners to know which part of AWS is requesting engagement.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.EngagementInvitationSummary.Status
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Status.
Represents the current status of the Engagement Invitation, such as Pending, Accepted, or Rejected. The status helps track the progress and response to the invitation.

member.name: T:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.EngagementMember
member.summary:
Engagement members are the participants in an Engagement, which is likely a collaborative project or business opportunity within the AWS partner network. Members can be different partner organizations or AWS accounts that are working together on a specific engagement.
Each member is represented by their AWS Account ID, Company Name, and associated details. Members have a status within the Engagement (PENDING, ACCEPTED, REJECTED, or WITHDRAWN), indicating their current state of participation. Only existing members of an Engagement can view the list of other members. This implies a level of privacy and access control within the Engagement structure.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.EngagementMember.AccountId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AccountId.
This is the unique identifier for the AWS account associated with the member organization. It's used for AWS-related operations and identity verification.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.EngagementMember.CompanyName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CompanyName.
The official name of the member's company or organization.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.EngagementMember.WebsiteUrl
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property WebsiteUrl.
The URL of the member company's website. This offers a way to find more information about the member organization and serves as an additional identifier.

member.name: T:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.EngagementMemberSummary
member.summary: The EngagementMemberSummary provides a snapshot of essential information about participants in an AWS Partner Central Engagement. This compact data structure encapsulates key details of each member, facilitating efficient collaboration and management within the Engagement.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.EngagementMemberSummary.CompanyName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CompanyName.
The official name of the member's company or organization.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.EngagementMemberSummary.WebsiteUrl
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property WebsiteUrl.
The URL of the member company's website. This offers a way to find more information about the member organization and serves as an additional identifier.

member.name: T:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.EngagementResourceAssociationSummary
member.summary: This provide a streamlined view of the relationships between engagements and resources. These summaries offer a crucial link between collaborative engagements and the specific resources involved, such as opportunities.These summaries are particularly valuable for partners navigating complex engagements with multiple resources. They enable quick insights into resource distribution across engagements, support efficient resource management, and help maintain a clear overview of collaborative activities.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.EngagementResourceAssociationSummary.Catalog
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Catalog.
Indicates the environment in which the resource and engagement exist.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.EngagementResourceAssociationSummary.CreatedBy
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CreatedBy.
The AWS account ID of the entity that created the association.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.EngagementResourceAssociationSummary.EngagementId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EngagementId.
A unique identifier for the engagement associated with the resource.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.EngagementResourceAssociationSummary.ResourceId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ResourceId.
A unique identifier for the specific resource. Varies depending on the resource type.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.EngagementResourceAssociationSummary.ResourceType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ResourceType.
Categorizes the type of resource associated with the engagement.

member.name: T:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.EngagementSort
member.summary: Specifies the sorting parameters for listing Engagements.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.EngagementSort.SortBy
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SortBy.
The field by which to sort the results.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.EngagementSort.SortOrder
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SortOrder.
The order in which to sort the results.

member.name: T:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.EngagementSummary
member.summary: An object that contains an Engagement's subset of fields.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.EngagementSummary.Arn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Arn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the created engagement.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.EngagementSummary.CreatedAt
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CreatedAt.
The date and time when the engagement was created.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.EngagementSummary.CreatedBy
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CreatedBy.
The AWS account ID of the engagement creator.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.EngagementSummary.Id
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Id.
The unique identifier for the engagement.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.EngagementSummary.MemberCount
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MemberCount.
The number of members in the engagement.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.EngagementSummary.Title
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Title.
The title of the engagement.

member.name: T:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.ExpectedCustomerSpend
member.summary: Provides an estimate of the revenue that the partner is expected to generate from the opportunity. This information helps partners assess the financial value of the project.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.ExpectedCustomerSpend.Amount
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Amount.
Represents the estimated monthly revenue that the partner expects to earn from the opportunity. This helps in forecasting financial returns.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.ExpectedCustomerSpend.CurrencyCode
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CurrencyCode.
Indicates the currency in which the revenue estimate is provided. This helps in understanding the financial impact across different markets.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.ExpectedCustomerSpend.EstimationUrl
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EstimationUrl.
A URL providing additional information or context about the spend estimation.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.ExpectedCustomerSpend.Frequency
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Frequency.
Indicates how frequently the customer is expected to spend the projected amount. This can include values such as Monthly, Quarterly, or Annually. The default value is Monthly, representing recurring monthly spend.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.ExpectedCustomerSpend.TargetCompany
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TargetCompany.
Specifies the name of the partner company that is expected to generate revenue from the opportunity. This field helps track the partner’s involvement in the opportunity.

member.name: T:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetAwsOpportunitySummaryRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the GetAwsOpportunitySummary operation. Retrieves a summary of an AWS Opportunity. This summary includes high-level details about the opportunity sourced from AWS, such as lifecycle information, customer details, and involvement type. It is useful for tracking updates on the AWS opportunity corresponding to an opportunity in the partner's account.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetAwsOpportunitySummaryRequest.Catalog
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Catalog.
Specifies the catalog in which the AWS Opportunity is located. Accepted values include AWS for production opportunities or Sandbox for testing purposes. The catalog determines which environment the opportunity data is pulled from.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetAwsOpportunitySummaryRequest.RelatedOpportunityIdentifier
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RelatedOpportunityIdentifier.
The unique identifier for the related partner opportunity. Use this field to correlate an AWS opportunity with its corresponding partner opportunity.

member.name: T:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetAwsOpportunitySummaryResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the GetAwsOpportunitySummary operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetAwsOpportunitySummaryResponse.Catalog
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Catalog.
Specifies the catalog in which the AWS Opportunity exists. This is the environment (e.g., AWS or Sandbox) where the opportunity is being managed.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetAwsOpportunitySummaryResponse.Customer
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Customer.
Provides details about the customer associated with the AWS Opportunity, including account information, industry, and other customer data. These details help partners understand the business context of the opportunity.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetAwsOpportunitySummaryResponse.Insights
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Insights.
Provides insights into the AWS Opportunity, including engagement score and recommended actions that AWS suggests for the partner.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetAwsOpportunitySummaryResponse.InvolvementType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InvolvementType.
Specifies the type of involvement AWS has in the opportunity, such as direct cosell or advisory support. This field helps partners understand the role AWS plays in advancing the opportunity.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetAwsOpportunitySummaryResponse.InvolvementTypeChangeReason
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InvolvementTypeChangeReason.
Provides a reason for any changes in the involvement type of AWS in the opportunity. This field is used to track why the level of AWS engagement has changed from For Visibility Only to Co-sell offering transparency into the partnership dynamics.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetAwsOpportunitySummaryResponse.LifeCycle
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LifeCycle.
Contains lifecycle information for the AWS Opportunity, including review status, stage, and target close date. This field is crucial for partners to monitor the progression of the opportunity.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetAwsOpportunitySummaryResponse.OpportunityTeam
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property OpportunityTeam.
Details the AWS opportunity team, including members involved. This information helps partners know who from AWS is engaged and what their role is.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetAwsOpportunitySummaryResponse.Origin
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Origin.
Specifies whether the AWS Opportunity originated from AWS or the partner. This helps distinguish between opportunities that were sourced by AWS and those referred by the partner.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetAwsOpportunitySummaryResponse.Project
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Project.
Provides details about the project associated with the AWS Opportunity, including the customer’s business problem, expected outcomes, and project scope. This information is crucial for understanding the broader context of the opportunity.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetAwsOpportunitySummaryResponse.RelatedEntityIds
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RelatedEntityIds.
Lists related entity identifiers, such as AWS products or partner solutions, associated with the AWS Opportunity. These identifiers provide additional context and help partners understand which AWS services are involved.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetAwsOpportunitySummaryResponse.RelatedOpportunityId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RelatedOpportunityId.
Provides the unique identifier of the related partner opportunity, allowing partners to link the AWS Opportunity to their corresponding opportunity in their CRM system.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetAwsOpportunitySummaryResponse.Visibility
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Visibility.
Defines the visibility level for the AWS Opportunity. Use Full visibility for most cases, while Limited visibility is reserved for special programs or sensitive opportunities.

member.name: T:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetEngagementInvitationRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the GetEngagementInvitation operation. Retrieves the details of an engagement invitation shared by AWS with a partner. The information includes aspects such as customer, project details, and lifecycle information. To connect an engagement invitation with an opportunity, match the invitation’s Payload.Project.Title with opportunity Project.Title.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetEngagementInvitationRequest.Catalog
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Catalog.
Specifies the catalog associated with the request. The field accepts values from the predefined set: AWS for live operations or Sandbox for testing environments.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetEngagementInvitationRequest.Identifier
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Identifier.
Specifies the unique identifier for the retrieved engagement invitation.

member.name: T:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetEngagementInvitationResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the GetEngagementInvitation operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetEngagementInvitationResponse.Arn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Arn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that identifies the engagement invitation.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetEngagementInvitationResponse.Catalog
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Catalog.
Indicates the catalog from which the engagement invitation details are retrieved. This field helps in identifying the appropriate catalog (e.g., AWS or Sandbox) used in the request.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetEngagementInvitationResponse.EngagementDescription
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EngagementDescription.
The description of the engagement associated with this invitation.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetEngagementInvitationResponse.EngagementId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EngagementId.
The identifier of the engagement associated with this invitation.This ID links the invitation to its corresponding engagement.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetEngagementInvitationResponse.EngagementTitle
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EngagementTitle.
The title of the engagement invitation, summarizing the purpose or objectives of the opportunity shared by AWS.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetEngagementInvitationResponse.ExistingMembers
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ExistingMembers.
A list of active members currently part of the Engagement. This array contains a maximum of 10 members, each represented by an object with the following properties.
CompanyName: The name of the member's company.
WebsiteUrl: The website URL of the member's company.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetEngagementInvitationResponse.ExpirationDate
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ExpirationDate.
Indicates the date on which the engagement invitation will expire if not accepted by the partner.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetEngagementInvitationResponse.Id
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Id.
Unique identifier assigned to the engagement invitation being retrieved.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetEngagementInvitationResponse.InvitationDate
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InvitationDate.
The date when the engagement invitation was sent to the partner.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetEngagementInvitationResponse.InvitationMessage
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InvitationMessage.
The message sent to the invited partner when the invitation was created.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetEngagementInvitationResponse.Payload
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Payload.
Details of the engagement invitation payload, including specific data relevant to the invitation's contents, such as customer information and opportunity insights.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetEngagementInvitationResponse.PayloadType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PayloadType.
The type of payload contained in the engagement invitation, indicating what data or context the payload covers.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetEngagementInvitationResponse.Receiver
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Receiver.
Information about the partner organization or team that received the engagement invitation, including contact details and identifiers.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetEngagementInvitationResponse.RejectionReason
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RejectionReason.
If the engagement invitation was rejected, this field specifies the reason provided by the partner for the rejection.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetEngagementInvitationResponse.SenderAwsAccountId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SenderAwsAccountId.
Specifies the AWS Account ID of the sender, which identifies the AWS team responsible for sharing the engagement invitation.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetEngagementInvitationResponse.SenderCompanyName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SenderCompanyName.
The name of the AWS organization or team that sent the engagement invitation.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetEngagementInvitationResponse.Status
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Status.
The current status of the engagement invitation.

member.name: T:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetEngagementRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the GetEngagement operation. Use this action to retrieve the engagement record for a given EngagementIdentifier.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetEngagementRequest.Catalog
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Catalog.
Specifies the catalog related to the engagement request. Valid values are AWS and Sandbox.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetEngagementRequest.Identifier
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Identifier.
Specifies the identifier of the Engagement record to retrieve.

member.name: T:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetEngagementResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the GetEngagement operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetEngagementResponse.Arn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Arn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the engagement retrieved.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetEngagementResponse.Contexts
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Contexts.
A list of context objects associated with the engagement. Each context provides additional information related to the Engagement, such as customer projects or documents.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetEngagementResponse.CreatedAt
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CreatedAt.
The date and time when the Engagement was created, presented in ISO 8601 format (UTC). For example: "2023-05-01T20:37:46Z". This timestamp helps track the lifecycle of the Engagement.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetEngagementResponse.CreatedBy
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CreatedBy.
The AWS account ID of the user who originally created the engagement. This field helps in tracking the origin of the engagement.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetEngagementResponse.Description
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Description.
A more detailed description of the engagement. This provides additional context or information about the engagement's purpose or scope.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetEngagementResponse.Id
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Id.
The unique resource identifier of the engagement retrieved.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetEngagementResponse.MemberCount
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MemberCount.
Specifies the current count of members participating in the Engagement. This count includes all active members regardless of their roles or permissions within the Engagement.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetEngagementResponse.Title
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Title.
The title of the engagement. It provides a brief, descriptive name for the engagement that is meaningful and easily recognizable.

member.name: T:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetOpportunityRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the GetOpportunity operation. Fetches the Opportunity record from Partner Central by a given Identifier.
Use the ListOpportunities action or the event notification (from Amazon EventBridge) to obtain this identifier.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetOpportunityRequest.Catalog
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Catalog.
Specifies the catalog associated with the request. This field takes a string value from a predefined list: AWS or Sandbox. The catalog determines which environment the opportunity is fetched from. Use AWS to retrieve opportunities in the Amazon Web Services catalog, and Sandbox to retrieve opportunities in a secure, isolated testing environment.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetOpportunityRequest.Identifier
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Identifier.
Read-only, system generated Opportunity unique identifier.

member.name: T:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetOpportunityResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the GetOpportunity operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetOpportunityResponse.Arn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Arn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies the opportunity.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetOpportunityResponse.Catalog
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Catalog.
Specifies the catalog associated with the request. This field takes a string value from a predefined list: AWS or Sandbox. The catalog determines which environment the opportunity information is retrieved from. Use AWS to retrieve opportunities in the Amazon Web Services catalog, and Sandbox to retrieve opportunities in a secure and isolated testing environment.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetOpportunityResponse.CreatedDate
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CreatedDate.
DateTime when the Opportunity was last created.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetOpportunityResponse.Customer
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Customer.
Specifies details of the customer associated with the Opportunity.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetOpportunityResponse.Id
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Id.
Read-only, system generated Opportunity unique identifier.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetOpportunityResponse.LastModifiedDate
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LastModifiedDate.
DateTime when the opportunity was last modified.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetOpportunityResponse.LifeCycle
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LifeCycle.
An object that contains lifecycle details for the Opportunity.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetOpportunityResponse.Marketing
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Marketing.
An object that contains marketing details for the Opportunity.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetOpportunityResponse.NationalSecurity
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NationalSecurity.
Indicates whether the Opportunity pertains to a national security project. This field must be set to true only when the customer's industry is Government. Additional privacy and security measures apply during the review and management process for opportunities marked as NationalSecurity.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetOpportunityResponse.OpportunityTeam
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property OpportunityTeam.
Represents the internal team handling the opportunity. Specify the members involved in collaborating on this opportunity within the partner's organization.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetOpportunityResponse.OpportunityType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property OpportunityType.
Specifies the opportunity type as renewal, new, or expansion.
Opportunity types:
New opportunity: Represents a new business opportunity with a potential customer that's not previously engaged with your solutions or services.
Renewal opportunity: Represents an opportunity to renew an existing contract or subscription with a current customer, which helps to ensure service continuity.
Expansion opportunity: Represents an opportunity to expand the scope of a customer's contract or subscription, either by adding new services or increasing the volume of existing services.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetOpportunityResponse.PartnerOpportunityIdentifier
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PartnerOpportunityIdentifier.
Specifies the opportunity's unique identifier in the partner's CRM system. This value is essential to track and reconcile because it's included in the outbound payload sent back to the partner.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetOpportunityResponse.PrimaryNeedsFromAws
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PrimaryNeedsFromAws.
Identifies the type of support the partner needs from Amazon Web Services.
Valid values:
Cosell—Architectural Validation: Confirmation from Amazon Web Services that the partner's proposed solution architecture is aligned with Amazon Web Services best practices and poses minimal architectural risks.
Cosell—Business Presentation: Request Amazon Web Services seller's participation in a joint customer presentation.
Cosell—Competitive Information: Access to Amazon Web Services competitive resources and support for the partner's proposed solution.
Cosell—Pricing Assistance: Connect with an Amazon Web Services seller for support situations where a partner may be receiving an upfront discount on a service (for example: EDP deals).
Cosell—Technical Consultation: Connect with an Amazon Web Services Solutions Architect to address the partner's questions about the proposed solution.
Cosell—Total Cost of Ownership Evaluation: Assistance with quoting different cost savings of proposed solutions on Amazon Web Services versus on-premises or a traditional hosting environment.
Cosell—Deal Support: Request Amazon Web Services seller's support to progress the opportunity (for example: joint customer call, strategic positioning).
Cosell—Support for Public Tender/RFx: Opportunity related to the public sector where the partner needs Amazon Web Services RFx support.
Do Not Need Support from Amazon Web Services Sales Rep: Indicates that a partner doesn't need support from an Amazon Web Services sales representative, and the partner solely manages the opportunity. It's possible to request coselling support on these opportunities at any stage during their lifecycle. Also known as, for-visibility-only (FVO) opportunity.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetOpportunityResponse.Project
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Project.
An object that contains project details summary for the Opportunity.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetOpportunityResponse.RelatedEntityIdentifiers
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RelatedEntityIdentifiers.
Provides information about the associations of other entities with the opportunity. These entities include identifiers for AWSProducts, Partner Solutions, and AWSMarketplaceOffers.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetOpportunityResponse.SoftwareRevenue
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SoftwareRevenue.
Specifies details of a customer's procurement terms. Required only for partners in eligible programs.

member.name: T:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetResourceSnapshotJobRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the GetResourceSnapshotJob operation. Use this action to retrieves information about a specific resource snapshot job.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetResourceSnapshotJobRequest.Catalog
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Catalog.
Specifies the catalog related to the request. Valid values are:
AWS: Retrieves the snapshot job from the production AWS environment.
Sandbox: Retrieves the snapshot job from a sandbox environment used for testing or development purposes.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetResourceSnapshotJobRequest.ResourceSnapshotJobIdentifier
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ResourceSnapshotJobIdentifier.
The unique identifier of the resource snapshot job to be retrieved. This identifier is crucial for pinpointing the specific job you want to query.

member.name: T:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetResourceSnapshotJobResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the GetResourceSnapshotJob operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetResourceSnapshotJobResponse.Arn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Arn.
he Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the snapshot job. This globally unique identifier can be used for resource-specific operations across AWS services.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetResourceSnapshotJobResponse.Catalog
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Catalog.
The catalog in which the snapshot job was created. This will match the catalog specified in the request.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetResourceSnapshotJobResponse.CreatedAt
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CreatedAt.
The date and time when the snapshot job was created, in ISO 8601 format (UTC). Example: "2023-05-01T20:37:46Z"

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetResourceSnapshotJobResponse.EngagementId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EngagementId.
The identifier of the engagement associated with this snapshot job. This links the job to a specific engagement context.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetResourceSnapshotJobResponse.Id
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Id.
The unique identifier of the snapshot job. This matches the ResourceSnapshotJobIdentifier provided in the request.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetResourceSnapshotJobResponse.LastFailure
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LastFailure.
If the job has encountered any failures, this field contains the error message from the most recent failure. This can be useful for troubleshooting issues with the job.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetResourceSnapshotJobResponse.LastSuccessfulExecutionDate
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LastSuccessfulExecutionDate.
The date and time of the last successful execution of the job, in ISO 8601 format (UTC). Example: "2023-05-01T20:37:46Z"

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetResourceSnapshotJobResponse.ResourceArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ResourceArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource being snapshotted. This provides a globally unique identifier for the resource across AWS.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetResourceSnapshotJobResponse.ResourceId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ResourceId.
The identifier of the specific resource being snapshotted. The format may vary depending on the ResourceType.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetResourceSnapshotJobResponse.ResourceSnapshotTemplateName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ResourceSnapshotTemplateName.
The name of the template used for creating the snapshot. This is the same as the template name. It defines the structure and content of the snapshot.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetResourceSnapshotJobResponse.ResourceType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ResourceType.
The type of resource being snapshotted. This would have Opportunity as a value as it is dependent on the supported resource type.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetResourceSnapshotJobResponse.Status
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Status.
The current status of the snapshot job. Valid values:
STOPPED: The job is not currently running.
RUNNING: The job is actively executing.

member.name: T:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetResourceSnapshotRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the GetResourceSnapshot operation. Use this action to retrieve a specific snapshot record.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetResourceSnapshotRequest.Catalog
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Catalog.
Specifies the catalog related to the request. Valid values are:
AWS: Retrieves the snapshot from the production AWS environment.
Sandbox: Retrieves the snapshot from a sandbox environment used for testing or development purposes.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetResourceSnapshotRequest.EngagementIdentifier
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EngagementIdentifier.
The unique identifier of the engagement associated with the snapshot. This field links the snapshot to a specific engagement context.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetResourceSnapshotRequest.ResourceIdentifier
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ResourceIdentifier.
The unique identifier of the specific resource that was snapshotted. The format and constraints of this identifier depend on the ResourceType specified. For Opportunity type, it will be an opportunity ID

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetResourceSnapshotRequest.ResourceSnapshotTemplateIdentifier
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ResourceSnapshotTemplateIdentifier.
he name of the template that defines the schema for the snapshot. This template determines which subset of the resource data is included in the snapshot and must correspond to an existing and valid template for the specified ResourceType.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetResourceSnapshotRequest.ResourceType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ResourceType.
Specifies the type of resource that was snapshotted. This field determines the structure and content of the snapshot payload. Valid value includes:Opportunity: For opportunity-related data.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetResourceSnapshotRequest.Revision
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Revision.
Specifies which revision of the snapshot to retrieve. If omitted returns the latest revision.

member.name: T:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetResourceSnapshotResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the GetResourceSnapshot operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetResourceSnapshotResponse.Arn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Arn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the snapshot. This globally unique identifier can be used for resource-specific operations across AWS services.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetResourceSnapshotResponse.Catalog
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Catalog.
The catalog in which the snapshot was created. Matches the Catalog specified in the request.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetResourceSnapshotResponse.CreatedAt
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CreatedAt.
The timestamp when the snapshot was created, in ISO 8601 format (e.g., "2023-06-01T14:30:00Z"). This allows for precise tracking of when the snapshot was taken.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetResourceSnapshotResponse.CreatedBy
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CreatedBy.
The AWS account ID of the principal (user or role) who created the snapshot. This helps in tracking the origin of the snapshot.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetResourceSnapshotResponse.EngagementId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EngagementId.
The identifier of the engagement associated with this snapshot. Matches the EngagementIdentifier specified in the request.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetResourceSnapshotResponse.Payload
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Payload.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetResourceSnapshotResponse.ResourceId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ResourceId.
The identifier of the specific resource that was snapshotted. Matches the ResourceIdentifier specified in the request.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetResourceSnapshotResponse.ResourceSnapshotTemplateName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ResourceSnapshotTemplateName.
The name of the view used for this snapshot. This is the same as the template name.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetResourceSnapshotResponse.ResourceType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ResourceType.
The type of the resource that was snapshotted. Matches the ResourceType specified in the request.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetResourceSnapshotResponse.Revision
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Revision.
The revision number of this snapshot. This is a positive integer that is sequential and unique within the context of a resource view.

member.name: T:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetSellingSystemSettingsRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the GetSellingSystemSettings operation. Retrieves the currently set system settings, which include the IAM Role used for resource snapshot jobs.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetSellingSystemSettingsRequest.Catalog
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Catalog.
Specifies the catalog in which the settings are defined. Acceptable values include AWS for production and Sandbox for testing environments.

member.name: T:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetSellingSystemSettingsResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the GetSellingSystemSettings operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetSellingSystemSettingsResponse.Catalog
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Catalog.
Specifies the catalog in which the settings are defined. Acceptable values include AWS for production and Sandbox for testing environments.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.GetSellingSystemSettingsResponse.ResourceSnapshotJobRoleArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ResourceSnapshotJobRoleArn.
Specifies the ARN of the IAM Role used for resource snapshot job executions.

member.name: T:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.InternalServerException
member.summary:
This error occurs when the specified resource can’t be found or doesn't exist. Resource ID and type might be incorrect.
Suggested action: This is usually a transient error. Retry after the provided retry delay or a short interval. If the problem persists, contact AWS support.

member.name: T:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.LastModifiedDate
member.summary: Defines a filter to retrieve opportunities based on the last modified date. This filter is useful for tracking changes or updates to opportunities over time.

member.name: P:Amazon.PartnerCentralSelling.Model.LastModifiedDate.AfterLastModifiedDate
member.summary:
